item.title: The CJEU once again reinforces the EU's external role with In Vino Veritas ruling.
item.description:
Steve Peers While only a handful of EU countries excel in wine production, it’s enjoyed throughout the Union. This simple truth underpins the recent Germany v Council ruling, where the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) bolstered the EU’s foreign relations authority, aligning with several previous decisions. Background This case centers on instances where Member States act as ’trustees’ of the EU’s external competence. This situation arises when the EU, despite having authority over a subject, cannot join a treaty or international organization dealing with it (a frequent occurrence)...
